verses.text: After these things did king Ahasuerus promote Haman the son of Hammedatha the Agagite , and advanced him, and set his seat above all the princes that \add were\add* with him.

And all the king’s servants , that \add were\add* in the king’s gate , bowed , and reverenced Haman : for the king had so commanded concerning him. But Mordecai bowed not, nor did \add him\add* reverence.
Then the king’s servants , which \add were\add* in the king’s gate , said unto Mordecai , Why transgressest thou the king’s commandment ?

Now it came to pass, when they spake daily unto him, and he hearkened not unto them, that they told Haman , to see whether Mordecai’s matters would stand : for he had told them that he \add was\add* a Jew.
And when Haman saw that Mordecai bowed not, nor did him reverence , then was Haman full of wrath.

And he thought scorn to lay hands on Mordecai alone; for they had shewed him the people of Mordecai : wherefore Haman sought to destroy all the Jews that \add were\add* throughout the whole kingdom of Ahasuerus , \add even\add* the people of Mordecai. \p

¶ In the first month , that \add is\add*, the month Nisan , in the twelfth year of king Ahasuerus , they cast Pur , that \add is\add*, the lot , before Haman from day to day , and from month to month , \add to\add* the twelfth \add month\add*, that \add is\add*, the month Adar. \p

¶ And Haman said unto king Ahasuerus , There is a certain people scattered abroad and dispersed among the people in all the provinces of thy kingdom ; and their laws \add are\add* diverse from all people ; neither keep they the king’s laws : therefore it \add is\add* not for the king’s profit to suffer them.\f + \fr 3.8 \ft for the…: Heb. meet or, equal, etc\f*

If it please the king , let it be written that they may be destroyed : and I will pay ten thousand talents of silver to the hands of those that have the charge of the business , to bring \add it\add* into the king’s treasuries.\f + \fr 3.9 \ft that they…: Heb. to destroy them\f*\f + \fr 3.9 \ft pay: Heb. weigh\f*
And the king took his ring from his hand , and gave it unto Haman the son of Hammedatha the Agagite , the Jews’ enemy.\f + \fr 3.10 \ft enemy: or, oppressor\f*
And the king said unto Haman , The silver \add is\add* given to thee, the people also, to do with them as it seemeth good to thee.

Then were the king’s scribes called on the thirteenth day of the first month , and there was written according to all that Haman had commanded unto the king’s lieutenants , and to the governors that \add were\add* over every province , and to the rulers of every people of every province according to the writing thereof, and \add to\add* every people after their language ; in the name of king Ahasuerus was it written , and sealed with the king’s ring.\f + \fr 3.12 \ft scribes: or, secretaries\f*

And the letters were sent by posts into all the king’s provinces , to destroy , to kill , and to cause to perish , all Jews , both young and old , little children and women , in one day , \add even\add* upon the thirteenth \add day\add* of the twelfth month , which is the month Adar , and \add to take\add* the spoil of them for a prey.
The copy of the writing for a commandment to be given in every province was published unto all people , that they should be ready against that day.
The posts went out , being hastened by the king’s commandment , and the decree was given in Shushan the palace. And the king and Haman sat down to drink ; but the city Shushan was perplexed.
